lines.text: I'm accustomed to getting what I want. I want that bear!
My guess is, he's out shooting the rapids, or wrestling a grizzly bear. You know, just being that Alaskan mountain man we know and love.
Dad, you used to fly 747s, and now you deliver toilet paper.
This isn't hunting. This is business.
These young people, they... they were brought up on MTV and video games. They know nothing of the real world. They can't conceive of the true brutality of nature.
"Dear poachers, this is very bad. I'm telling."
Are you sure this is how they do it?
It's how they do it on ESPN.
What's that? It's either a polar bear or the whitest dog I've ever seen.
It's a dog. Can I keep him?
When I was a boy, you had to hunt a bear with just a spear, and you took his spirit or died trying.
[On the Inuit boy's first hunting trip]
Go a boy and come back a man.
Let's get rid of this kayak before any unwanted company comes.

[sees a helicopter]
Who the hell is that?
Unwanted company.
Sean, trust the bear.
Robbed!
[kicks the makeshift cage in frustration]
I don't believe this! Is there no place safe anymore?
Nice landing, Jake, that's a stiff cross wind.
Any landing you can walk away from is a good one.
I bet you didn't say that when you were flying 747s for a living...
Yeah, I could say anything I wanted, as long as I didn't spill any drinks in first class.
One way or another, if you're persistent, fortune always smiles on you.
Look! It wasn't my fault!
Son, in Alaska; if it happens to you, it's your fault.

[she and Sean are coming ashore after flipping their kayak in the cold water]
This is great. Really great.
I'm gonna freeze to death.
So whats the big deal? We'll make a fire.
Good. I hope you brought the matches.
I can't believe you're dumb enough to forget the matches!
What do you wanna do, Pocahantas? Rub sticks together?
Mayday, mayday! 909Tango is going down! Mayday, mayday, mayday!
[screams]
